intro: Onobroma dentatum, commonly known as the Florida waxplant, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, waxy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and have a slightly toothed margin, giving it the species name "dentatum." Onobroma dentatum thrives in sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and dunes.
